answers.answer: At 27 weeks my son was measuring near 30 weeks in some areas but I'm now 36 weeks and he's measuring right around 36/37 weeks. My ultrasound tech said they go through growth spurts inside too and he should even out eventually and he did :) Try not to stress!

My Dr told me it's very common for babies to have a major growth spurt between 28 and 34 weeks. Then growth slows back down. It is not mean baby will be big or that a c section is necessary. Remember growth is in centimeters, 2 weeks isn't actually that much overall.

GD is something you'll monitor with your Dr. They would tell you if they thought there was a major concern about growth. Right now there's no reason to get worked up. Just stick to your diet plan to control it.

When I was 29 weeks, my daughter was measuring at 31 weeks. My doctor said it doesn't mean the baby is coming early or anything. It's just one of those things that sometimes happens. At first, I thought it was because my fiancée is 6'7" so maybe my daughter was taking after his side of the family and she is long for her gestational age, but who knows. As long as your baby is healthy, that's all that matters.

question: Hello allI wanted to ask a question I am 30 weeks and my baby is,measuring at 32 weeks which is bigger I was diagnosed with gestional diabetes in my last trimaster I  completely stressed out because a c section may be realistic need help suggestions anything from other  situations from women would be great thank you. I feel like crying I'm so devastated and don't know what to expect with a much needed ultrasound.
title: my baby is measuring 2weeks ahead
